alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fergus and south central Blaine Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles northeast of Winifred, or 29 miles southwest of Zortman, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Fergus and south central Blaine Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
